title: What do I do to counter this play?
body:
You have to stay behind the minions when vs blitz, but what do i do when blitz zones us by walking behind us or sitting in the bush behind us? Their bot lane is ahead (they have blitz, theyre always going to be ahead). 
What do we do?

we cant go up and farm because then blitz just walks out, knocks up cait, pops his silence, then when she finally gets away he just pulls her back. And during that time Ez (or whatever other adc) has joined the fight to kill cait and then me.

We cant just focus blitz, because he will just pull one of us and that person will get raped 1v2 in the bush.

We cant just sit there because we cant afford to lose any more xp and farm to them.

Pretend we cant roam because all lanes are pushed. 

In the picture (excuse the quality) our lane is pushed hard, but this can happen even on our side of the lane too, if the lane is pushed past the first bush, he just sits in it and stops us from farming and if we go close, PULL+KNOCKUP+ULT=DEAD

so what do we do in this situation?
(dont make it specific to these champions, i only used them cos they are colour coded, blitz is the only champ that we are concerned with) 

thank you

replies.body:
Ward the bush, dodge the hooks and start beating down on the Blitz because he is so far ahead of his ADC.

If your getting pulled by blitz, unfortunately that is the problem, as that really shouldn't ever occur.
What if he doesn't pull from the bush, what if he walks out from the bush behind you, knocks you up, then ults, then pulls you only after you flash away.
Then Taric isn't doing his job and Caitlyn hasn't been laying traps.
(dont make it specific to these champions, i only used them cos they are colour coded, blitz is the only champ that we are concerned with)

Simple then, let's talk about how varus will deal with this, he is a poke champion with an AOE slow that he can place down. He will use his mana to take opportunities to poke the enemy ADC, Jinx and twitch will just farm unless her support picks out a good engage. Lucian will also poke and use his mobility to avoid hooks. 

Leona and Alistar want that hook so that they can jump onto the enemy ADC, thresh simply has to outplay Blitzcrank. Janna will throw her tornado, Zilean and Zyra will harass with high AP ratios and stuns. 

There's too many to name, but you play to the strengths of your champion.


Blitzcrank is a very binary champion who has a pull and only a knock up for CC. His silence is a bit too short i think to make a real difference though its a little bursty. Compare him to thresh, Tahm kench, Lulu, he has very little room for play making potential. He isn't tanky without building tanky support items.  He can only really make a play if he lands a hook.

This basically, i can't think of a champion combination that have any actual problems with this happening, as again the only reason you are going to have a problem is if blitz pulls you.

If your letting him in melee range there are so many other problems to address with your mindset.

So i would be safe in assuming that you have never been pulled by a blitz hook?
And have never let blitz in melee range? ever.

Which is weird because a lot of champs need to get in melee range in order to actually do anything.

No, but you are safe to assume that I personally have fought many blitzcrank's, played as blitzcrank, and thus know specifically how to play against him. When you play a melee champion in the botlane, you would want someone who is innately tanky like {{champion:54}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:44}}  {{champion:223}}  against a blitz specifically so that when they level up a bit, they are tanky enough to survive an all in against blitzcrank's comp.

Just think for a second, Blitzcrank's hook is literally his strongest ability in terms of strength and utility, if he uses it and misses, capitalize on it. 

When play {{champion:89}} I let myself get pulled on purpose :3
this is all great, but it doesn't help if I'm not a tank.

Well you have {{champion:117}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:26}}{{champion:25}}  

who also have a strong lane against blitzcrank where they can harass when he gets close, have strong CC, which can be used to disable blitzcrank or his adc, upon an engage, you can use these abilities to disengage,  and shove blitz out of lane if you play it safe.

Soraka's silence can prevent blitzcrank from using his knock up, as well as provide powerful heals which can sustain a team fight which can help your ally escape a blitzcrank pull. 

{{champion:37}}  could outsustain them big time in a war of attrition. At level 6 you can easily all, and win the trade if the jungler comes by.

Caitlynn should actually be very good in this situation, first off either wait for the next allied minion wave. It's best to lose the exp and gold rather than give them an extra 15 minions worth of gold at the same time as costing yourself more. 

Secondly, Caitlynn laying traps in the bushes and harassing blitz with her AA over the minion wave should in fact shove blitz back. You don't have to worry about trading, if Ezreal tries to make a play, use Taric's stun or Caitlynns trap (if you're skilled enough) to stun/snare him, so that he will take damage. You don't have to kill him, just hurt him so much that staying in lane is detrimental. Use your Q to harass Ezreal the much squisher ADC as it has a much wider hitbox, odds are he'll have to blink to avoid it which has a long cooldown. 

As an ADC you don't stop moving, keep moving between AA's that way you can avoid the volley's being fired at you since they are skill shots that cost mana and travel in a linear direction. Don't focus blitzcrank unless he screws up at the start of the game and or hasn't build tank items throughout. 

Furthermore, don't run in a straight line knowing blitz has his hook up, if you move side to side very quickly while running he will most likely miss as it has a very small width. In fact it's so small I have in the past been able to dodge a hook at point blank.

Another thing, you don't have to all in, Caitlynn is a lane bully, she should excel at this particular matchup.

What if it was another of the 13 marksmen? you're never guaranteed to have caitlin vs blitz every time. what do you do then? 

Also if it was that easy to dodge his hook every time, he wouldn't be a viable pick. But as it turns out he is one of the most viable pick, which means that you aren't going to dodge it every single time especially at point blank range.

He wouldn't be a viable pick if no one made the mistakes that enables a blitzcrank to hook. It's the same scenario regardless. You play to your advantages. Blitzcrank is only good if his opponent makes the mistake needed to facilitate his hook. I main support, and I also play ADC a lot, I can tell you this is very much the case. 

In my opinion Blitzcrank is one of the weakest support picks against a competent lane.

Well blitzcrank has a 20+% pick in the player range from platinum to challenger, (with a 53% win rate)

and those players are a lot more 'competent' than you and me, so i guess they must play the whole game and win 53% of the time without landing a single hook aye? 

so he cant be that bad of a support if he can do that?

There are a lot of supports with that pick rate and a close to equal or even higher pick rate.  In fact Blitzcrank isn't normally picked in the LCS though he might very well be from time to time but the truth isn't a common pick for a very particular reason. We're looking at the highest level of play where teams will do their best to pull a perfect play. People realize there are other supports that function as very specific counters to Blitzcrank, and while you may not seem to think so, counterplay to blitzcrank in many scenarios is in your hands.

I know counter-play to blitz is in my hands, thats why i made a whole post asking how to counter him, however saying (oh just dodge the blitz hooks) is not a counter (thats like saying, oh just don't go near zed so he cant ult you) the game doesn't work like that. Because just as hard as you are trying to dodge them, blitz is trying to hit them. and both of us are players of an even skill level, so its not going to be one of us always landing/dodging the hook every time, it will be a mix of both. 

and you cant base the whole balance of the game around LCS, sure they don't pick blitz as often, but their game is completely different to the one we play. they are less than 1% of the population. (its like saying, oh we should just make ALL the rugby posts in the country much higher because Dan carter would still be able to kick the ball over them, screw all the kids In school learning how to play!)

Dodging blitzcrank's hook is legitimate advice, since I've seen many people running from him run in a straight line and get hooked.  Learning to avoid skill shots is a fundamental mechanic of league of legends on many champions. Hell if you can't dodge a blitzcrank hook I don't know what hope you have against a thresh or a leona or a nautilus. Thresh and Nautilus's hook are much wider and Leona's Zenith blade bypasses minion waves and hits the last champion in its range pulling her to him.

I'll tell ya, blitzcranks hook each time he fires it, at level 1 he's drained a whole third of his mana in one go, his hook is down for approximately 15 seconds, meaning he is partially useless for that entire period. If you're set to go in on a full engage, do it when blitzcrank misses because then the most he can is ult and knock up if he can even get close to you before his ADC comes to the risk of dying.

{{champion:53}} pull is an almost instant pull to him. 
It's the combo that hurts like {{champion:12}}  combo.
Pull, knock up, silence. Thats a lot of damage with no return damage at all.
{{champion:412}} hook is a slow pulling hook and {{champion:89}} goes to you forcing her adc/allies to catch up.
So basically unless you play {{champion:81}} or support {{champion:113}}, it's going to be a hard lane.
I've seen a blitz pull curve and grab, I have also seen a blitz pull go through your minions.

Just because Blitz's hook is almost instant doesn't mean it's not dodgeable, you have to predict where Blitz plans to land it and he'll have to predict where you'll be when he does fire it.

I'm sorry to say this man, but you're actually wrong it doesn't go through minions. It also doesn't curve, it just has to connect with the hit box. If it connects with a minions hitbox, then it will always pull the minion, if it connects with your hitbox it will always pull you. To put it simply the actual size of the hitbox is actually something you can't see. The hook might go in between minions it would never go through. 

Blitzcrank's hook is very linear and thin, Thresh's hook while slow is a lot wider than Blitzcrank's hook.

If your adc isn't within the minion wave, then they are playing poorly, if Leona got pulled from out of reach of the minion wave then that's a really bad call. 

xD I'm sorry but the information you're presenting is that you make stupid mistakes. If you don't make the aforement mistakes then Blitzcrank's ADC is very dead as he doesn't have the CC to peel as well as other.

Furthermore Alistar's combo is stronger than Blitzcranks, Alistar's proper combo is a point and click when performed properly is utterly inescapable, where as with blitz you can still dodge the hook regardless. 

Blitzcrank is not as OP as some people here are trying to make him out to be.  Not to mention Blitzcrank's silence is extremely short. 

and finally thresh's hook is an actual stun, yes it's CC, if you get pulled by this you are more likely to die here than by a blitzcrank pull because it's very hard to escape thresh due to his actual stun mechanics, his flay throwing you back and his ultimate box. He also has the versatility to save allies, provide a small shield, and become tanky without actually building tank. His auto attack is a pseudo melee ranged attack where he can harass over minion lines.

I main {{champion:412}} and  {{champion:89}} and currently is a level 5 {{champion:53}}  as well. I am not a diamond or Platinum. IN fact I am Bronze and I can easily tell you that Blitzcrank is not overpowered from the hundreds of games that I have played and the experience that I have gained over time.

Also I think it's highly possible that people are misjudging the hitbox of Blitzcrank's hook and mistaking it for actually going through minions unless maybe you could pull a video on it. I've played Blitzcrank many times and have never actually experienced it specifically passing through minions. 

Also what about patch 6.9 makes blizcrank god tier specifically?
It's a lot harder to dodge an accurate Plat+ blitzcranks hook then a bronze/silver blitz hook.

You have to remember that its only Plat+ people that are dodging a plat+ blitz hook, and its only bronze/silver people dodging a bronze/silver blitz hook, so it all evens out. Its just as hard for a silver player to dodge a silver hook, as it is for a diamond player to dodge a diamond hook. 

because the skill is relative.

Lets assume this is around the level 6-10 mark as the towers are up, blitz silence has become over powered to your lane... 

I'm going to do this in bullet point form and keep it simple

* LANE CONTROL! Look where the wave is fighting, if you're losing farm and xp to zoning, why are you letting the minions push past your safety? 

* Wards! Even if you don't upgrade at level 9- (i often dont because i want 2 wards around) you've no reason to not have the brush warded if blitz is using this tactic

* Traps! There is no excuse for Caitlyn being unable to at the very least PUSH his camp spot in the brush with smart traps

* If you have a jungler with a gap closing ability (Lee, Xin, Yi etc) and they're reasonably farmed and confident, get him to dive the ADC from behind coming through enemy tower / tribrush and Taric and Caitlyn can collapse onto Blitz as your jungler comes into 3v1 on him

* If you're pushed and it doesn't impact, go kill the krugs. They're worth more than a wave of minions anyways.  And it will allow enemy minions to push the wave to your side of the lane and relative safety

1) Supp body blocks.
2) You picked the champs/lane matchup. Ali+Luc will do well into the blitz/ez matchup.
3) If you are really that far behind , go farm jung, pressure somewhere else or just hover within xp range of the enemy minions, if they engage ( supp body blocks blitz hook ) then its 2v2+6minions.
4) Blitz is a non sustain lane, body block hooks, trade, heal up.
5) Vision control. Blitz mana pool isnt limitless and during his hook downtime is your opening to trade aggressively against their lane.

Sure some matchups feel quite one sided sometimes, but you have to let it get there through your own bad plays. From wave 1 minion control, trading and last hitting has started, if you find yourself being completely zoned it is most likely due to your own early bad plays/good enemy plays. Call your jung down, tell them blitz is aggressive and it will turn into a 2v3.

Well I gave you some suggestions along with many others that posted in this thread. You see there is no specific counterplay to beat any champion, it requires a multitude of different decisions made during champion select, early lane minion wave control, how to trade, item build paths, previous experience and many other factors. This is why many favour "stable" adc picks like cait, luc and ez , if you are not confident enough in your mechanics to dodge blitz hooks ( which means you shouldnt confident enough to position correctly and dodge other forms of CC ) then don't play Jhin, Ashe, Varus , Kogmaw , *insert other adc that has low mobility* unless your support is going to play something tanky who can body block/peel etc.

Whenever someone makes any suggestion you reply back with "oh but then this champ can do x, and what if im first pick and why do i choose x champ when y hasn't even been locked in. *sigh* you're really not getting it, pretend we aren't in ranked if it'll make it easier. So what we do in champion select is not an option for counterplay.

In game there are certain ways of counter-playing a champ/situation, as all (or most) other champs.

For example, to counter a Aurelion Sol gank (when he comes flying in with a lane wide stun) is to land a (preferably) long range ability on him as soon as he gets in range, this will immedialty stop his E a fair distance away from you. You will likely be stunned, but it should have worn off by the time he walks to you now. This doesn't require changing your whole team comp to stop this play. 

When fighting a Yasuo, you wait for him to use his wall, and then get behind it before you throw your most valuable abilities at him. Again this is a situation that obviously frustrates people, but it has clear counterplay, just like the Sol ganks.

To play agent kindred's ult, you Zhonya's just after it begins, and as soon as Zhonya's ends, you ignite her and that way, you get the full heal while taking no damage, and she only gets half the heal. Or if you're not a mage then you just don't use your cc until it ends then stun her, (or better, knock her out of her ult just before it ends) 

To counter taric's ult, as soon as you see it happening, disengage the fight, they will want to chase you (so that they dont feel that they wasted it) and just before it ends, you turn around, and go all in on them.

All champions have (or at least should have) ways to play around their abilities In a certain situation. Ways that don't require a certain champ for it to be a success (obviously some champs make it easier to counter, and some make it harder, but the same logic still applies) 

what i wan't to know, is how to play agent this situation AS ANY CHAMP (yes even if they aren't tanky) and that isn't just 'oh well dodge the hook, duuhuhaha' 

'Dodging' isn't counterplay, dodging is something you try to do to EVERY enemy skillshot that gets thrown at you its not counter play, its just trying to to die, like 'running away' you cant say 'he's fed, oh well just run away! duhuaha' because running away is obvious and you do it to everyone when you're in danger. 

I want to know the specific counterplay for this situation.

[EDIT]: An example of the difference between counter-picking and counter-play

The enemy has a Zed. If the Zed picks before you in champ select, you can pick a champ like Kayle, to counter his ult.

If you pick before the Zed (and as such, don't pick kayle) it doesn't mean you're fucked for the rest of the game. it just makes it harder to play against him. But you can still do it by waiting for him to use his ult, and the instant he becomes targetable again after it, you flash and or dash away which means he has to use his W to chase you (if its not on cd) instead of doing more damage to you, which cuts a significant portion out of his ult damage. 

Or if you want to duel him to the death, when he ults you, you run back to the point where he cast it, so that you can duel him there without him zapping back out of the fight as soon as he is in danger. 

Now if you did pick kayle, obviously its easier to counterplay him because your ult counters him. But if youre not kayle the same logic still applies.

THAT is what i want again blitz, not what champion to pick.

The game is balanced around ranked, that there are 3 available bans on each side, with a pick order. During a real professional game both teams discuss strategy and pick based on what comp they would like to run. They don't sit there saying " oh man blitz has no counterplay we should instant lock him". If its a blind? Well tough luck, that's not what the game is balanced around. Why do you think Riot have pushed DQ so hard?

Dodging is counterplay, positioning is counterplay. The selection of champion is counterplay. It is actually you who doesn't get it. If you cant dodge a hook then how are you going to dodge a wrench?

How do you think people play mid? They learn how to dodge skill shots, it is a fundamental part of the game. How is it that hard to understand?

blitz isn't picked or banned in every game, therefore teams do NOT evolve around blitz and it is FUCKING possible to have a non tanky support against blitz. Why is that so difficult for you to understand??

Dodging isn't counterplay, its an expected move that you are supped to be doing to every single champion with a skillshot. Its like Moving and farming, youre just expected to try to dodge something if it comes at you. Counterplay is something specific to a champion or situation where you do a specific move that counters theirs, Dodging is not a counter, blitz tries to pull you, you try to dodge it, if youre the same skill level its a 50/50% chance that it will hit to not (cos he isn't going to fire his hook unless he thinks he can get you) 
if it misses then you capitalise, and if it hits you die. Thats not counterplay, thats capitalising on a mistake. You're supposed to do that on every champ. 

Champion specific counter-play is not dodging, its knowing what to do (and doing it) one you already get in a sticky situation. Like the Zed ult example we just talked about. You cant counterplay a zed ult until he has used it. Its the same with blitz, he fires the hook, you try to dodge it, if it hits you, THEN you adjust your play to try and counter the situation, for example use the new circumstance to go all in on the adc or something like that.

I know how mid laners play, i happen to be one. But Dodging a skillshot isn't counterplay, take Azir for example, he places a soldier and Q's you, dodge it if you can, but its pretty fast and fairly wide, and at a close rang its pretty hard to miss (take it from an azir main). So lets pretend we got hit by it, what can we do in this situation to turn it around in our favour? Well he now has his soldier away from him, so if you dash in close, he cant do anything for a good couple of seconds. We have now turned the situation around (counterplay).

Like Aurelion Sol, Sure try dodge the stars as much as you want, but its better to take one to the face and get in close to him where he is useless, than it is to sit on the outer ring dodging stars all day. 

So as you can see, dodging and counter playing are different things.
